column4: for some reason ubuntu/xubuntu will not mount primary "C" partition.. it's 500gb with vists 64bit
mount <devspec> <mountpoint> -t ntfs
what do you get
you get what on stderr
i don't know?
well it must say something otherwise how do you know its failing
says fuse: failed to access mountpoint.
are you issuing it through sudo
yes.
you already tried a different mountpoint
yes

it mounts the second hard drive just fine.. and mounts the external drives just fine. using thos commands. but it appears to refuse to do so for the one with vista installed on.. and all my hard drives except the one ubuntu is installed on are ntfs.
syntax as i get it should be sudo mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sda1 /mnt/wherever

it just says "fuse:failed to access mountpoint /mnt/whatever no such file or directory i've tried /media/whatever  and i get that when i type sudo mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sda1 /mnt/whatever or /media/whatever . normally use "windows" "vista" what ever i can think of. nothing seems to work.
you have to mkdir the mountpoint first
i have tried that as well.
what permissions on the mountpoint you mkdir'd
plus considering the fact i'm trying to put it in /mnt/windows  or /media/windows  it's root folder...
whats output of ls -l <that dir you mkdird>
it shows a few things.. and what it does show is root.
well if its not the obvious things then the next thing to investigate could be what supplemental paramters need to be passed to mount
but the message youre getting is saying pretty straight up the mount point isnt accessible and wasnt created in a proper way
if mount had an issue with the volume it was mounting it would have an error message for that
